meanings.definition: Existing only in theory or as a suggestion
meanings.sent1: The notional plan for the party was to have a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the notional concept of time travel to the students.
meanings.sent3: The notional idea of a talking dog in the movie made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her notional fear of spiders was so intense, she screamed at the sight of a tiny spider.
meanings.sent5: The notional possibility of aliens visiting Earth captured the imagination of many people.

meanings.sent1: The notional treasure map led the kids on a wild adventure.
meanings.sent2: His notional fear of ghosts kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The notional story of a magical unicorn brought smiles to the children's faces.
meanings.sent4: The notional idea of time being a loop fascinated the young scientist.
meanings.sent5: The notional concept of flying cars seemed like a dream come true to many.

meanings.definition: Based on an idea or concept rather than reality
meanings.sent1: The notional belief in luck charms brought her comfort during exams.
meanings.sent2: His notional plan to become a superhero involved wearing a cape and mask.
meanings.sent3: The notional notion of a chocolate river in the backyard amused the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her notional understanding of dragons made her write fantastical stories.
meanings.sent5: The notional concept of time as a river flowing endlessly resonated with the philosopher.
